title: Afghans decry foreign attacks after mosque bomb
description:
(2 Aug 2017) Relatives of those killed in a suicide attack at a Shiite mosque in Herat, Afghanistan held a protest on Wednesday at the scene of the bombing.
They denounced the US, the Taliban and Islamic State group and called on the government to do more to protect the people.
A suicide attacker opened fire inside the mosque packed with worshippers at evening prayers on Tuesday, before detonating his explosives. 
A second explosion came 10 minutes later.
No one has claimed responsibility for the bombing in western Herat province but it came a day after the Islamic State group warned it would attack Shiites.
Along with the 30 killed, 64 people were wounded, 10 of them critically.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/2b2abbd96839fa9a6b3dc0b0130e9f71
